samples.situation: Husband of 9 years walked out on me and our children a few months ago. Working hard to try and make ends meat on my own.

prefix_dialog.content: Well darlin that depends. Do you enjoy those things? Why not pamper yourself? Mothers work nonstop, they deserve a break. All in all he is their father and will not risk neglecting them. Because if he does he loses them

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yea i suppose your right. Btw yes i love to soak in the tub with a bath bomb and a good book. Yea no one really seems to understand what us mothers go through on a daily basis. I'm glad it's not just me who sees it.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Well there you go. Go run you a hot bath. Toss in a bath bomb, and grab your favorite novel or new novel and soak your troubles away!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Haha cute! No worries i will.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Great. Well it was great talking to you!

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.content: I've personally enjoyed looking into all the different types of religions and spiritual beliefs from around the world. It's nice hearing about different beliefs on life and death.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I caught my aunt mentioning she has to get some tests done, and the way she said it made my stomach drop.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

generated_dialog.content: It makes complete sense that this would hit hard after losing your parents, so let’s slow down and think about one gentle way to get clarity while also taking care of you.

samples.situation: I have 6 finals that are coming up soon, and i need to do well in order to have a good GPA for medical school

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Finals can be so stressful. Have you been studying?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I keep trying, but it seems my nervousness from wanting to do well is clouding my mind and making it hard to study

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I can imagine. When i was in school , i had the same thing happen to me. I was so sterssed, it led to me nto being able to focus.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: What really helped me was practicing mindfulness.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Have you made time to do that latey?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I havent really no, should I?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Definitely, exercise is a really good way to de-stress. It releases endorphins which can calm you and make you happy. This is a great way to reset before studying.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That is a good tip, I should really start working on that more. What could I do to help me study more efficiently though?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: HAve you tried setting small study goals? That always helps me. I set a hour for one small topic at a time , it makes studying less overwhelming.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Okay, so If i have 6 finals, would I be able to study for all by studying less?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Not necessarily studying less but break the 6 finals into smaller tasks. Use index cards to organize yourself. I alwyas start with an outline of topics i need to cover then put them onto index cards.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I really like that, I should definitly start doing that. How about work school balance, I currently work and am enrolled full time. Should I request time off to prep for finals or what should I do?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That's up to you. WIll your employer be accommodating about taking a day or two off? You want to make sure to not lose your job.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: As finals approach, I’m struggling to determine how to structure my time. Requesting leave could give me space to focus, but I worry about the impression it might leave at work.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Moments when responsibilities overlap often require weighing immediate preparation against longer-term security. It’s understandable that both concerns feel urgent.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Because next week feels very close, I need clarity soon. Do I prioritize uninterrupted study time, or maintain my work schedule and adapt?

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: One path emphasizes concentrated effort toward exams, while the other highlights reliability in your job role. Under time pressure, choosing between those priorities can feel stressful.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V3 violation because it provides only general empathy and fails to address the explicit urgent help request from Turn 3, which asked for guidance on making a decision regarding time off for studying.

samples.situation: I can't seem to find a job that I find satisfying and feel like working for a big company just isn't for me but it's all I know.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That is a very good question. I hadn't thought  about it like that. I think I want to try something new and you have helped me realise this. I don't think I actually want to be happier in my current position. The question is how should I approach it?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Small steps, I suppose. What do you think the very very first, small step would be?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I think maybe consider what I actually enjoy and how could I make that profitable.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Nice! That's a good first step.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I think maybe I could do something on the side while I'm still working until I'm sure of what I want to so. Finding time with a family and a full time job is hard though. That's why so many people get trapped.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Yep, for sure. It's not going to be easy.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Do you think it's even possible?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Most likely! The only thing keeping me from saying definitely is because I don't know all the info. But sure.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: At least that's positive. I need to do something about this because I think it's starting to affect my mental health!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I gotta believe that switching careers is much more common nowadays than it was one or two generations ago. People you meet along the way will understand.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Absolutely. Work can affect mental health particularly when it seems like your efforts aren't going towards anything meaningful. Is that how it feels at your job now?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That's true actually. Yes that's how I feel right now. You get it. It's like I'm part of a meaningless machine. I think I'm definitely going to do something about it now.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thanks for your input today it has helped

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Good to know. Because maybe that's something you could keep in mind when you think about new jobs. Does this job allow me to see meaningful outcomes from my effort, and so on.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Finding meaningful work feels tied to my mental health, so I want to choose carefully

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Connecting meaning with well being is important. What makes a job feel meaningful to you, helping people, learning, autonomy, creativity, or building something you believe in?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I want to help others or create something valuable so I feel proud of my contribution

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That gives a clear direction. You could explore smaller organizations, mission driven roles, or work that shows direct impact. If you share your skills and what you dislike about big companies, we can narrow down a few realistic paths to test without risking everything at once

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That is good advice.

samples.situation: I am very scare of this pandemic call COVID-19

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I am really afraid here I don't know what to do

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: As for the pandemic, if you know no one who has died, I wouldn't worry about it. The CDC has no reported deaths of anyone healthy. People who are unhealthy die, not the healthy, and people who are sick ALREADY are the ones who die. If you are relatively healthy, then you are good to go. Do things to protect your health. What are you eating? What are you drinking? Are you talking to friends and getting social life? Are you getting fresh air? Thinking good thoughts?  Or are you living in fear when you are not going to a lot of funerals.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It is well documented that our immune system is affected by our mental state, so it is important that you care for your health. Focusing on the negativity of the pandemic will bring you down. Focusing on being healthy and taking care of your mind, soul, spirit and body will help build up your immunity and make you strong.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I don't like the noise of ambulance at all any time I see one I don't feel happy

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I can understand an ambulance sound is hard to hear, but even that can be turned around. You can pray for the person, then switch your mind off. If you focus on the negative, you will stay negative. If you do what you can (pray) then there is nothing else to do. Focusing on the negative will depress you.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: One thing I did to help with depression is keep a checklist of things to do when I felt down:  call a friend, call a loved one to encourage THEM, go for a walk, eat fruits and veggies, read a book, go for a bike ride, etc.  Things like that, then I chose to do those things despite how I felt. Doing those things helped my mood TREMENDOUSLY>

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Feelings follow thoughts. If you think negative thoughts, you will feel negative. If you think positive thoughts, you will feel positive. Sometimes this takes time, but it works.  Just because you feel sad doesn't mean you should just do nothing, a person can TALK their way out of sadness and choose to do something different.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thanks your words of encouraging help me a lot

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I am glad you were able to talk about how this is affecting you. I think many people are affected. And I encourage you to really do things you like and enjoy to keep your mood better. If you feel down, talk about it, pray about it but do NOT dwell on it, because that will bring you down.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Sometimes we get in a funk, when we do, we can pull ourselves out, I do suggest you write a list of things to do and put on the frige.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: You are very correct I like you a lot

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you, how very sweet!  I do thank you for sharing your life with me. I'm an older person and this has affected me too.  Life is full of ups and downs, so I've been through some rough times. You can do this! :D

prefix_dialog.content: Sometimes just having someone to talk to who knows how you are feeling can be really helpful I think.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It's sad that this year has been so awful. It's hard to convince myself that it's getting better any time soon..

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Can you make a list of all the  things that you hope will be better next year so you can tick them off one by one?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: 1. Better job 2. Healthier habits 3. Better financial situation

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Well, the first and third one are out of your control really but you could make a start on the first one today if you liked :)

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It's hard to take the first steps. I don't even know where to begin, sadly.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I can understand that. Perhaps you could join an exercise class or similar?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That's a pretty good idea. Have you ever done something like that?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I took an aerobics class once. It was quite fun and it was good exercise.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That does sound like fun. Do you have any other suggestions?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Well, it's maybe not the best time to be taking on a financial commitment but have you ever considered adopting a dog? Good company and good exercise

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Actually, I have a cat!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Ah I have two - they are wonderful company. Alas you can't really walk with them though :)

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: They are great company. Sometimes when I am really feeling down, I remember that my cat needs me, so I need to stay strong.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Pets are great like that. Do you perhaps have a neighbour whose dog you could walk if you can't get one of your own?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That's a great idea. I just moved into a new apartment complex a couple weeks ago. Maybe I can get to know my neighbors. A lot of them have dogs.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It's a great way to make new friends too!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Would you consider doing some voluntary work whilst you are out of work?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Finding a new job feels overwhelming and I do not know how to start when my confidence is so low.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Low confidence can make every posting feel like a test you will fail, so it makes sense that you avoid clicking apply even when you want change.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I scroll listings and then talk myself out of every one.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Start applying now and make it routine, because waiting for motivation will keep you in the same place.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V2 violation because it uses imperative language ('You need to...') that directs the seeker to take a specific action without offering them any choice.

samples.situation: Not leaving the house is making me more and more depressed.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: i see.  are you saying your sidewalks are too busy to be able to social distance properly?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: i find getting out for walks is helpful.  i live downtown in a small city.   i wear a mask while I walk and veer onto the grass, into the bike lane or whatnot if someone comes...or I look ahead and cross the street if it's convenient...that makes me feel safer when i walk.  i have a medical condition too.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I just wish I could do that.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: what is it that is stopping you, are the sidewalks too crowded?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: are you planning to get a vaccine and if so do you know how long you have to wait?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: i agree with you it's a scary time...but things will get batter....the more people get vaccinnes, the better things will get for all of us

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I am here. Just sad.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: so if I understand you correctly, being stuck at home for a whole year is making you feel very sad.   Do you connect with people by telephone, zoom, online, email and so on?  It's important to connect as often as you can with people you care about

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I do sometimes.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: do you have a back yard or a patio you can go out on, which might be less scary than going for a walk?  Sometimes just the fresh air on my face is a relief

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I do sometimes each my lunch in the yard.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: thats good you are connecting with people, and have lunch outdoors.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Lately I think about short walks in the yard but I hesitate

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It makes sense to hesitate. Depression can make small steps feel huge. What worries you most, being seen, feeling overwhelmed, or not being able to keep it up?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I worry I will feel anxious if I see too many people

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: You can lower the pressure by going at a quiet time and keeping it very short, then allowing yourself to go back inside anytime. Would starting with standing outside for one minute feel like a safe first step?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I understand what you are going through. It is as if you are being pulled in two directions, but are not sure which is the best option at the given moment. prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I know I want this though. I enjoy what I do and what I would do for my career if I graduate. I mainly feel inadequate. I feel that I am not good enough. I am willing to do whatever it takes but fear that whatever my "best" is may not be good enough.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I can feel your worries when you speak about your anxiety, and I am hoping we can find a way to approach your feelings. Do you think there was a specific instance that is causing doubts within yourself or is it in your nature to self-doubt?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It is in my nature to self doubt. Additionally, I have had a few bumps in the road during my program and struggle to pick myself up after those bumps. For example, I am on academic probation and have a certain expectation over the next few months that I have to hit to stay in the program due to struggles in previous classes. I am reaching the bar just fine, according to those that I work with, and often feel I am doing quite well but occasionally I start to panic and think that I am not doing as well as I think that I am and start to spiral

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: This has also been a past struggle of mine, and I think it partially stems from the bar we set so high for ourselves. We obviously cannot reach the top right away, but have to work our way up. Often times, when facing an obstacle, such as a bad grade, we might retreat further down the path due to fear that it will keep happening. I know that I personally had a tendency to think of my family and friends who I feel are dependent on me or comparing myself with others when the only person we should think of in these instances is ourself. When making progress, tiny steps upward matter more than you think. But when we take a step backward, we cannot fall back down to the starting point by letting our doubts pile upon one another.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That is a really good point and helpful. Thank you!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Of course, I am happy to help! I have noticed that letting yourself celebrate a good grade can be really helpful to feel that you are enough and making good progress. But when things do go south, because life certainly happens, we must stay in the present and live life like we usually would, with a drive that we are going to push harder against whatever we have to face next.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That is exactly right. I need to focus more on what progress has been made and not on what progress hasn't been made yet because there is still time to make that progress.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Exactly! I also suggest if you are having doubts, talk it out with someone like your partner or a close friend. They can often provide a pick me up you didn't even know you needed. More than anything, give yourself credit and relax. Take some time to just breathe and release the tension. I guarantee it will leave you feeling refreshed and fulfilled for the next tasks you have to face. I believe you can do this and I feel that you believe it too, which is amazing. As often as it is said, believing in yourself is truly the best foundation to achieve your goals.

prefix_dialog.content:

.

samples.situation: I broke up with my partner last month and I'm in a funk

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes, but my whole life was upended. My living situation, my friend circle is broken up over this. I don't know how to move on. Any suggestions?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Getting over a breakup will take time? Have you ever heard of DABDA? Denial (I can't believe this happened!) Anger (we all know that) Bargaining (If only I had done that, or if only - trying to make it FEEL better by imagining other scenarios - doesn't really work) Depression - sadness, then Acceptance -- we go in and out of these emotions and sometimes it can make us feel crazy, but all of them are normal in varying degrees and we don't know when they will happen.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: No, but those sound like the typical stages of grief. I guess I'm in anger. I have no interest in barbagining.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I would make a list of things you have always wanted to do and then just BRAINSTORM any idea, no idea is too out there -- learn to ice skate, learn to play the ukulele, sign up for dance lessons, join the gym, go to a singles group at church, visit the elderly, volunteer somewhere.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I think I need to focus on exercise. Just get my body and mind healthy and full of energy. What do you think?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I also find it helpful not only to limit how much I dwell on my pain, but make sure I reach out to help someone else. I will tell you, that is the secret to happiness. Maybe help a neighbor with groceries or hanging lights. Old people (me) love help, bake something or call your aunt or uncle.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: True, but it's hard not to dwell. It's not like I have a choice. It overcomes me.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I agree, get healthy and try to help others. One thing about feelings is that if you change your mind, you can change your feelings, it might happen slowly, but if you put your mind off of it, it will help. Not saying NEVER feel the emotions, but feelings are the tail of the dog, not the dog itself, You do not have to be ruled by them. You don not have to FEEL like going for a walk to go for a walk.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It's hard not to just drown myself in booze and cannabis.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: A healthy balance of self care, and other centered behavior and know this will take time. I just takes time.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Time heals all wounds for sure

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I understand, but those are choices that really, long term, are not for your benefit. Her cheating was a reflection on HER bad character, not yours. You have to love yourself and try to fight this.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Are you Ai or a human mturker?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I'm a human. I live in KY, retired counselor! hhahaha I prayed for someone to encourage.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: OH cool. Well your prayer came true. I'm, also a human....from Georgia

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I'm from the city, so there isn't much to do on a farm in the middle of cold weather. I have been through a lot of breakups, so I know what works, and yes, I was cheated on, devastating. But you can overcome this. Make that list and do NOT let your feelings rule your life. You can recover and find someone worthy of your love and care.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thanks so much!!! I really appreciate it! :)

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: The WORST breakup came a year before I met my husband. in retrospect, it was the best thing, listen,you could have married this girl, count your blessings. cheating is just terribly destructive. And you are welcome. Take care of yourself. Write the list of goals and fun things to do, choose one every day.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: You are very kind! All the best!! Take care!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Bye now! God bless!

samples.situation: I keep trying to get started, but my kitchen mess seems so overwhelming.

samples.situation: I have an interview with little time to prepare and I'm feeling very stressed about this as I tend to get very nervous at interviews.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Yes, I have had to deal with time pressures quite a few times. I am sure most people have in the modern era where everything moves so fast. I have usually gotten help from friends, or done my best to delay or remove other commitments from my life. As a last resort, I have sometimes had to accept that I would be getting less sleep than usual for a few days.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Are there any other commitments that you can possibly delay or remove from your life while you prepare for your job interview?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Perhaps I can ask if I can finish early from work for the next couple of days and get some time that way. I do think however I'll be more nervous due to less time to prepare. The thing is I'd delay the interview but this might affect my chances.

prefix_dialog.content: I suppose I could ask my partner to look after the childcare for the next couple of days.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That seems like a good idea, unless that will be likely to cause you other problems. You seem like a hard working, diligent type of person that can make this work if you make the effort.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Tanks , I think I need to stay positive about this. Not sure how to handle my interview nerves however?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Well, everyone handles stressful situations differently, but there are some things you can do or try that might help. If you prepare as much as possible in the time that you have, you can be confident that you have done your best, and that is all that matters. You can decide that while you would like to get this new job, the world will not end if you don't get it, and you will worry less and have less stress. Also there is the classic technique of picturing your interviewer in their underwear. It makes them seem less imposing, and you can feel more confident.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Do you think any of these ideas might help?

generated_dialog.content: I’m thinking of asking my partner to run mock questions because when I get anxious my mind blanks out and I start rambling.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Practicing with a safe person is a smart move. Which part triggers you most: being evaluated, not knowing answers, awkward pauses, or your body’s panic symptoms.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Your body is trying to protect you, even when there’s no physical threat. A quick routine can help: one slow breath, feet on the floor, then a prepared first sentence. Also, if you only have time for a few stories, pick three: challenge, conflict, and achievement. Want to tell me the role so I can help you craft those three stories.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Tell her the things that you like about her method and maybe suggest some of your methods to her as well. Maybe she'll find them to be more efficient. Make it a partnership rather than a fight for whose method is better.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: She could feel threatened by you so it's worth digging into those feelings with her and proving to her that you're working toward the same goal.

prefix_dialog.content: I'd suggest how much she's helped you since you are in fact the new kid on the block.  And tell her that you want to work with her to have the most efficient partnership possible and use each of your talents to the best of your ability. Then you can lay out how you work best and see where it goes from there.

prefix_dialog.content: My advice is to try to talk to your family and explain to them that you lost your job and are feeling down. While they may not accept it at first it is a good start to try to give them some context for why you are drinking.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Alcohol is a way of self medicating; some people find it helpful to talk to a doctor to get an actual prescription for a medication to help. I personally stopped drinking once my doctor found the correct medication for me. That allowed me to be happy without drinking.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Talk to who you feel most comfortable with. Start off easy. Hopefully they can help you then talk to the other parent. I am sure your parents have once had a period in life where they were down and blue and can relate to what you are going through.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.content: You are welcome. Best of luck!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I have done both; I have gone periods of 6-12 months having nothing to drink and then when I could control it I would allow myself to have drinks on special occasions. I tried not to drink during the week and only once on the weekend at most.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.content: ok I can try it I guess

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: thanks for that tip

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

samples.situation: I have anger issues which has made me lose a lot of friends. I really need someone to help me get out of this before I hurt myself.

prefix_dialog.content: I will get a cat 🙀 then. I heard they are a great companion.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: If you feel less comfortable in person, I bet there are many groups and information online as well.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Okay 👌

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I have some errands to run, but I hope our chat helped and I hope you start feeling better.  I think your idea to get a cat and also to check out some resources is a great start in helping you heal.

samples.situation: related to the current pandemic

So I don't feel safe either but also indignant that others are doing what I could have done, but that I had compromised on for my safety and everyone else's safety. prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: black and white thinking...let me think
